Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Whack \Whack\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Whacked}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Whacking}.] [Cf. {Thwack}.] 1. To strike; to beat; to give a heavy or resounding blow to; to thrash; to make with whacks. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
Rodsmen were whackingtheir way through willow brakes. --G. W. Cable. [1913 Webster]
2. To divide into shares; as, to whack the spoils of a robbery; -- often with up. [Slang] [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
whacked adj : (British informal) exhausted or worn out
